messages: 0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:47): BrandonTurner - that's what I actually suggested to sedwards too
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:48): one simple patch management system. Patch will never get lost, author will at least get its status
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:48): and also feedback, if Alexandre has time to write it
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (20:50): yeah
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (20:50): their system is really silly
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (20:52): BrandonTurner, hi
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (20:53): hello encoded
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (20:53): hey why does the hooking stuff need to be in C++ again?
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:54): oh, GvG dislikes git
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:54): I thought he'd like it as all wine people do :)
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (20:55): gvg is a reactos person at heart
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:55): yes, I must have became strict, remove everyone from commit access except me
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:55): and review/forgot about patches in reactos
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:55): then he would still have been with us
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (20:57): encoded: gloabl hooks need to be in unmanaged code because they are injected into other processes
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (20:57): I'm desperate to write a reply "do it as in reactos - patch goes into bugzilla"
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (20:57): and you cant inject managed code into unmanagaed code
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (20:58): i see..
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (20:58): where does this injectin take place?
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (20:59): the system handles it
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:00): http://windowssdk.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms644990.aspx
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (21:00): going to be able to run EVERYTHING out of the box
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:01): we use WH_SHELL and WH_MOUSE_LL
27b09da4ba36799a61813264b66764bb (21:02): Which (fs) driver model does ros aim for? xp, w2k3, or vista?
e57bfaa8e7e230ed9e3930bde6a8a001 (21:03): is there a fundemntal difference between xp and 2k3, driver wise?
0c71284007ea3912cc191b374461962f (21:04): Elrond - generally the answer for driver compatibility would be 2k3
e57bfaa8e7e230ed9e3930bde6a8a001 (21:05): *fundamental
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (21:05): i read some time ago that someone wrote a working uxtheme.dll but won't commit it to the repos. Is this correct?
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:08): i dont think i ever heard that
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:08): wine has one
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:08): that is somewhat functional i think
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:08): but we dont have it in our tree(at least not all of it)
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:09): but that information could be incorrect so dont hold me to it
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (21:09): there is an old version in our tree or maybe even modified
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (21:10): the wine version "works" in windows.. meaning it loads
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (21:10): but does nothing usefull
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (21:10): afaik
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (21:11): thx so far, i think before we talk about themes and gui design we need a working uxtheme.dll
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (21:11): indeed
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (21:13): BrandonTurner, why does the form that pops up with debug msgs have a text input bar? it doesnt seem to do anything

e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (21:14): and i think details throws an exception
